text: John Powell (3 June 1892 – 7 February 1961) was an English footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Port Vale and Nottingham Forest. ==Playing career== Powell joined Port Vale in 1911, and made his debut in a 1–0 defeat at Lincoln City in a Central League match on 25 December 1911. He remained as the club's back-up goalkeeper for the next three seasons. He went on to play 21 Second Division matches for Nottingham Forest in the 1914–15 season. He returned to Port Vale during World War I, and played as a guest from August 1916 until he lost his first team place in September 1917. ==Statistics== Source: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="4"|Port Vale |1911–12||Central League||1||0||0||0||1||0 |- |1912–13||Central League||3||0||0||0||3||0 |- |1913–14||Central League||1||0||0||0||1||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !5!!0!!0!!0!!5!!0 |- |Nottingham Forest |1914–15||Second Division||24||0||1||0||25||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !29!!0!!1!!0!!30!!0 |} ==References== Category:1892 births Category:1961 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Burslem Category:English footballers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Port Vale F.C. players Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players Category:Port Vale F.C. wartime guest players Category:English Football League players
